FacilityName: SOUTHERN FS, INC - PINCKNEYVILLE NH3 SITE

_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: ANHYDROUS BULK STORAGE TANK, TRANSFER PUMP, TRANSFER HOSES, ANHYDROUS RISER AND ALL RISER HOSES AND COUPLERS.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
                                                          PINCKNEYVILLE, IL    NH3 SITE


1.  FACILITY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY.

  THE MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES OF SOUTHERN FS, INC  ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTIAL RELEASES OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  IF AN ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPT., OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE
TO PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

2.  THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND THE REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED.

  THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY,  WHICH IS LOCATED AT 510 WEST KASKASKIA STREET PINCKNEYVILLE, IL  IS THE STORAGE AND BLENDING OF FERTILIZERS FOR  SALE TO FARMERS.  ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED AND DISTRIBUTED FOR DIRECT APPLICATION AS A CROP PRODUCTION NUTRIENT.  THE STORAGE AND HANDLING SYSTEM CONSISTS OF 1 STORAGE TANK (30,000  GALLONS), LOADING RISERS, ASSOCIATED PLUMBING AND NURSE TANKS.  ACCESS TO THE SITE IS RESTRICTED TO AUTHORIZED FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AUTHORIZED MANAGEMENT PERSONNEL AND AUTHORIZED CONTRACTORS.

     THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT CAN BE STORED WOULD BE 
    325,000 POUNDS. THIS INCLUDES ANHYDROUS AMMONIA THAT COULD BE STORED IN NURSE
     TANKS.

3. THE WORST-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO AND THE ALTERNATIVE-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO.

   THIS FACILITY HAS DEVELOPED A WORST-CASE RELEASE AND ALTERNATIVE-CASE RELEASE SCENARIO. HOWEVER SINCE THIS IS SECURITY SENSITIVE INFORMATION IT HAS BEEN WITHHELD FROM THIS EXECUTIVE SUMMARY AS REQUIRED BY E.P.A. REGULATIONS.

4. THE ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

  THIS FACILITY COMPLIES WITH EPA'S ACCIDENTIAL RELEASE PREVENTION RULE AND WITH ALL 
APPLICABLE STATE CODES AND REGULATIONS.  THIS FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISION OF SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA,
K-61.1,  PUBLISHED BY THE AMERI

CAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE, INC. AS ADOPTED BY STATE REGULATION AND THE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH
ADMINISTRATION (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.  COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REGULATIONS AND ON-GOING TRAINING OF OUR EMPLOYEES MAKE UP
OUR ACCIDENT RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM.

5. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY.

  THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF ACCIDENTAL RELEASES IN THE PAST FIVE YEARS THAT HAVE OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY;
  1. WE HAD AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF LESS THAN 1000#S OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA ON APRIL 12, 2006.THERE WERE NO EVACUATIONS BUT ADJACENT HOMES AND BUSSINESS WERE NOTIFIED FOR 
RECAUTIONARY MEASURES

6. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM.

 THE FACILITY HAS ...  A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA 
STANDARD, 29 CFR 1910.38; PROVIDED STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT- TO- KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III  (EPCRA);
IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY INVOLVING ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, IT IS OUR POLICY TO NOTIFY THE PINCKNEYVILLE FIRE DEPT. AND THE PERRY COUNTY LEPC AND REQUEST THAT THEY RESPOND
TO THE EMERGENCY. OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLANS HAVE BEEN COORDINATED WITH BOTH THE FIRE
DEPARTMENT AND LEPC.           

7. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY.

  SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY.  PERIODIC EVALUATIONS
ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS.  THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC SAFETY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AT THIS TIME.
